summary: Email correspondence between U.S. Attorney's Office personnel regarding Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) requests related to Jeffrey Epstein. The email attaches Epstein's indictment and provides links to public materials, while also mentioning possession of civil case filings and FBI Palm Beach's FOIA production on the initial investigation.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the FOIA requests and attached indictment; charged with sex trafficking of minors in Manhattan federal court.

events.title: Indictment of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein charged in Manhattan federal court with sex trafficking of minors.

events.title: FOIA Request Follow-up
events.description: Email request to pull together Epstein press releases, charges, and other public materials.

keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York possesses Epstein's indictment from July 2019.
The office has a copy of the FOIA production from FBI Palm Beach regarding the initial investigation into Epstein.
The office also has a selection of filings from civil cases pulled from public dockets, though they are hesitant to reveal which suits were tracked.
Public materials include press releases and court documents related to the case against Jeffrey Epstein.
